snippet.textDisplay:
I personally enjoyed OoE more (i got somewhat obsessed with it, to be honest =D), but PoR, although I never completed it (played on a friend's copy), was still an awesome game. And lets face it, most Castlevania games are.
Oh, and the music's great. XD
snippet.textOriginal:
I personally enjoyed OoE more (i got somewhat obsessed with it, to be honest =D), but PoR, although I never completed it (played on a friend's copy), was still an awesome game. And lets face it, most Castlevania games are.
Oh, and the music's great. XD

snippet.textDisplay: Dang, I'm surprised.  The moment this started, I thought it was definitely Sakuraba.  It sounds just like his work in Tales of Symphonia and Golden Sun.

snippet.textDisplay:
Order of Ecclesia.

Portrait of Ruin is a rushed games with bugs, and a clear lack of polish. It runs with so many ideas...and does none of them well.

The rehashed paintings, lame co-operative elements, the pointless subweapon grinding, it all adds up to a package that tries to be a jack of all trades, but masters none.

At best, look at PoR as an anniversary game, with references to older games. Looking at it as a fresh, unique game will probably lead to direct disappointment and fury.
snippet.textOriginal:
Order of Ecclesia.

Portrait of Ruin is a rushed games with bugs, and a clear lack of polish. It runs with so many ideas...and does none of them well.

The rehashed paintings, lame co-operative elements, the pointless subweapon grinding, it all adds up to a package that tries to be a jack of all trades, but masters none.

At best, look at PoR as an anniversary game, with references to older games. Looking at it as a fresh, unique game will probably lead to direct disappointment and fury.

One of the game's more subtle tracks, but nonetheless, it is a very good one.

Unless you've already done so, I hope you'll upload some music from Order of Ecclesia.  Ebony Wings is one of the best from that game.
